subject: RE: [junit] Assertions and Annotations
msgSnippet: Shane, JUnit 4 uses AssertionError as its base exception class, so failed Java assertions are handled exactly the same way as failed assertions in tests. You
messageBody:
Shane,

JUnit 4 uses AssertionError as its base exception class, so failed Java
assertions are handled exactly the same way as failed assertions in tests.
You have to run your application with -ea to enable assertions, which is why
the test to demonstrate this is not part of the standard suite.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute
